abstract.text: Review the changes made in this version of the library

inlineContent.text: Fixed errors in color conversion functions in
Nix Universal SDK functions must now be enabled with a license key using the
types have added cases related to
errors. Refer to the API documentation linked below for additional details.
now returns an optional data type.
is not provided by the active license.
Fixed signal strength (RSSI) not updating while the
Updated project settings for use with Xcode 15.0
Minimum supported iOS version changed to 12.0
Improved error reporting during device connection
Fixed issue that caused status codes to be reported as
instead of the proper error code during the connection process
Added support for Nix Spectro L devices
Allows override of the maximum Delta E threshold used when performing in-field calibration
Review the API reference linked above for additional details
Updated field calibration routine for Nix Spectro 2 devices
Additional diagnostics are performed during the white tile scan on Spectro 2 type devices. As a result, the calibration command can now take 5 - 10 seconds to complete
The operation can now fail with status
if the tile measurement delta exceeds the allowable threshold
This function forces the field calibration record to expire on QC and Spectro 2 type devices
Review the API reference linked above for additional details
Added public access to list of attached USB devices to
Added ISO Density calculations and supporting classes
Denisty data can be obtained from measurements as
section has been updated to reflect its usage

Review an example project which provides a C/C++ interface for macOS applications

Start field calibration using provided reference tile, if supported. Upon executing this command, the scan of the reference tile will begin immediately. The user MUST be prompted to place the device onto the reference tile BEFORE this method is executed. This method is asynchronous and will return immediately.
This command requires data from the reference tile QR code. As the format varies between different device types, the string data should be provided exactly as decoded from the QR code.
A library to allow integration of Nix devices into third-party iOS and macOS applications.

Flag to indicate if in-field calibration is recommended for this device at this time (if supported). This value is only valid after opening a connection and is a function of both time and ambient temperature. This value also updates each time a measurement is completed.

Maximum Delta E threshold used when performing in-field calibration (if supported), or NaN if the device does not support this operation. If a difference from the reference greater than this value is detected during

Class used to manage the license for the Nix Universal SDK. Members of this class are not instantiated or accessed directly. Access to a single shared instance is provided via static methods and properties.
